entries.meaning: A facial expression where one slightly raises one corner of the upper lip, generally indicating scorn.

verbs.description: sneer (third-person singular simple present sneers, present participle sneering, simple past and past participle sneered)

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To raise a corner of the upper lip slightly, especially in scorn
(transitive) To utter with a grimace or contemptuous expression; to say sneeringly.
examples: to sneer fulsome lies at a person
"Now here's someone who should attend privilege workshops," sneered she.
